title: Rich Troedson
text:
Richard LaMonte Troedson (born May 1, 1950) is a retired <a href="United%20States">American</a> <a href="pitcher">pitcher</a> in <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League Baseball</a> who played from through for the <a href="San%20Diego%20Padres">San Diego Padres</a>. Listed at , , Troedson batted and threw <a href="left-handed">left-handed</a>. He was selected by the Padres in the 1st round (6th pick) of the 1972 out of <a href="Santa%20Clara%20University">Santa Clara University</a>.
In a two-season career, Troedson posted an 8–10 record with a 4.74 <a href="earned%20run%20average">earned run average</a> in 65 appearances, including 19 <a href="starting%20pitcher">start</a>s, two <a href="complete%20game">complete game</a>s and two <a href="save%20%28sport%29">saves</a>, giving up 90 earned runs on 191 hits and 67 <a href="base%20on%20balls">walks</a> while <a href="strikeout">striking out</a> 92 in 171.0 innings of work.
